experience: You and Keith both know Dimitri Ponomareff, David Price, and 5 others
Mediware Rehabilitation and Respiratory Care Solutions

As lead analyst, responsible for requirements and design (UI/UX) of the following new features:   * Clinical documentation with charge capture and plan of care for inpatient rehabilitation for physicians, nursing, therapists, and social workers/case managers;   * Clinical documentation with charge capture and plan of care for outpatient rehabilitation for therapists (PT, OT, SLP);   * Scheduling for inpatient rehabilitation and for outpatient rehabilitation, including front-office workflow for processing intake/admission/discharge, physician referrals, and insurance authorizations;   * Operational and analytical reports;   * Integration with EHR/EMR systems for physician orders and ADT using HL7; and   * Integration with software used for processing PQRS, IRF-PAI, and therapy exercises.Experience includes:   * Facilitating customer focus groups;   * Designing UI/UX, including process maps, customer journeys, user personas, wire-frames, and prototypes;   * Working in Agile framework with Kanban and Scrum, creating Epics and User Stories with acceptance criteria, and combing the Backlog;   * Working with off-shore development teams;   * Designing applications for client-server, Citrix, web, mobile devices (tablets and smartphones), SaaS (on-premises and on-demand);   * Managing team of analysts;   * CMS regulations for Inpatient Rehabilitation Facility Patient Assessment Instrument (IRF-PAI), 3-hour therapy rule, 4th day plan of care, Correct Coding Initiative (CCI), Time-Unit Reconciliation (a.k.a. 15-minute rule), Multiple Procedure Payment Reduction (MPPR), Manual Medical Review (MMR), and Physician Quality Reporting System (PQRS);   * Working with CPT and ICD-10 codes for physical therapy;   * Training in HIPAA and handling PHI; and   * Over 50 site visits to hospitals and outpatient facilities for ethnographic analysis and workflow consulting.
Currently assist in Merit Badge Counseling for Astronomy and Space Exploration.
Mediware Rehabilitation and Respiratory Care Solutions

Requirements Engineering II at Becton Dickinson Company (Formerly CareFusion)

Keith has a unique talent in being able to extract necessary information from Product Managers and focus groups to bridge the gap in communication between the IT and the Clinical people responsible for requirements.  Through thoughtful questioning, experience, and personality, Keith is able to help take an idea from concept to design through communication and cooperation.  I have watched him negotiate with QA and Engineering, encourage Product Management to consider alternate solutions, and sit with clinicians to determine workflows into product development.  He is confident in his experiences, yet open to new technologies and ideas.  Strong recommendation.

Keith is an extremely customer focused talent who has the unique ability to understand client needs and translate these into realistic and effective product development.  I have observed Keith in several difficult situations where client expectations did not necessarily match the scope of the project.  One of Keith's strengths is his ability to communicate with clients and help them understand product roadmaps.  At the same time, Keith is able to pick up on critical nuances that clients require and push for these to be incorporated in product development.  Keith is a strong advocate for clients, but at the same time he recognizes the delicate balance between their needs and his own organization's mission and strategic vision.

summary: Over 30 years of professional software engineering experience encompassing the following activities of the development life cycle: feasibility, requirements analysis and management, architecture and design, UI/UX design, coding and unit testing, database design, change management, system testing, deployment, and continuous process improvement.  Additional experience includes project management, staff manager, customer support, integration and interoperability, basic research, and process and tools evaluation, acquisition, and deployment.  This experience includes new development, maintenance, and support with Fortune 50 companies, the United States government, and small companies.  As a consultant and direct employee, utilized Agile/Scrum, Rational Unified Process (RUP), and classic waterfall for the development of applications and integration.Domains: Healthcare (Inpatient/Outpatient EMR); Supply Chain Management; Banking; Defense (C3I); Aeronautics (ATE); TelephonySoftware Languages: C, Visual C++, Fortran, Visual Basic, SQL (MS-SQL, Oracle)Operating Systems: Unix, VMS, OS/2, MS-WindowsTools: MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-Project, MS-Access, Visual Studio, MS-Visual Studio, Rational Rose, Visio, FeaturePlan, DOORS, ClearCase, CVS, WinRunner, Visual Use Case
